references.paper_title: Probing classifiers: Promises, shortcomings, and advances
references.reason: This paper is a survey on using probing classifiers to understand what linguistic features are learned by the model.
This work introduces the MMLU benchmark, which the paper uses to evaluate the impact of removing certain tokens.

references.paper_title: Locating and editing factual associations in GPT
references.reason: This paper studies how to locate and edit factual knowledge within GPT models, which is relevant to understanding the internal representations of LLMs.

references.paper_title: Language models are unsupervised multitask learners
references.reason: This paper is fundamental as it introduces language models as multitask learners.

references.paper_title: Scaling monosemanticity: Extracting interpretable features from claude 3 sonnet
references.reason: This study examines how to scale mechanistic interpretability research for large language models.
